summary: This is an email chain from December 2021, forwarding a personal account from an individual named Keith. Keith recounts meeting a young girl on Long Beach Island, NJ, in the summer of 1976-77, who claimed Ghislaine Maxwell was her sister. The narrative describes a brief, unsettling encounter with Jeffrey Epstein, after which the girl appeared afraid. The following day, Maxwell allegedly told Keith the girl had died, then changed the story to say she had run away, after which both nearby houses were quickly vacated.

persons.name: Keith
persons.context: Author of the forwarded email recounting a personal encounter from the summer of 1976-77 with a young girl, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Jeffrey Epstein on Long Beach Island, NJ.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of account, alleged sister of the young girl
persons.context: Described by the young girl as her sister. According to Keith's account, she answered the door the day after the initial encounter and gave conflicting stories about the girl's disappearance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Individual encountered by Keith and the young girl
persons.context: Encountered by Keith and the young girl during a walk. His presence caused the girl to become afraid and submissive.

connections.description: Both are present in the same location and timeframe in the account, with Maxwell allegedly lying to cover for events involving Epstein.
The young girl claimed Maxwell was her sister, though their accents were noted as different.
The girl became immediately afraid and submissive upon encountering Epstein, suggesting a controlling or threatening dynamic.

events.title: Encounter on Long Beach Island
events.description: Keith meets a young girl who claims Ghislaine Maxwell is her sister. During a walk, they encounter Jeffrey Epstein, causing the girl to become afraid and submissive.

events.title: Disappearance of the Young Girl
events.description: Keith returns to find the girl gone. Ghislaine Maxwell first claims the girl died, then changes the story to say she ran away home. Both nearby houses are reported empty by the next day.

locations: Area near the Long Beach Island bridge, ocean side, two blocks left of bridge
keyFacts: The account alleges an early encounter (summer 1976-77) involving Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and an unnamed young girl on Long Beach Island, NJ.
The young girl claimed Ghislaine Maxwell was her sister, but their accents were different, raising questions about the claim.
Upon encountering Epstein, the girl's demeanor changed dramatically to being afraid and submissive.
The following day, Maxwell gave conflicting stories about the girl's fate, first claiming she had died, then that she had run away, after which the nearby houses were vacated.
The witness (Keith) provides a specific detail for verification: a 1976-77 brown/gold Mopar Aspen station wagon associated with Epstein.
